member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.AvoidType
member.summary: Specifies the road types to minimize or avoid when the route is created for the driving travel mode.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.AvoidType.Highways
member.summary: Avoids the use of highways in the route.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.AvoidType.Tolls
member.summary: Avoids the use of toll roads in the route.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.AvoidType.MinimizeHighways
member.summary: Minimizes (tries to avoid) the use of highways in the route.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.AvoidType.MinimizeTolls
member.summary: Minimizes (tries to avoid) the use of toll roads in the route.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ConfidenceLevel
member.summary: The level of confidence that the geocoded location result is a match.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ConfidenceLevel.None
member.summary: No confidence level set.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ConfidenceLevel.High
member.summary: High confidence match.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ConfidenceLevel.Medium
member.summary: Medium confidence match.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ConfidenceLevel.Low
member.summary: Low confidence match.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageResolutionType
member.summary: An enumeration for image resolution.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageResolutionType.Default
member.summary: The default resolution.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageResolutionType.High
member.summary: High DPI resolution.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageFormatType
member.summary: Imagery format types.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageFormatType.GIF
member.summary: GIF image format.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageFormatType.JPEG
member.summary: JPEG image format. JPEG format is the default for Road, Aerial and AerialWithLabels imagery.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageFormatType.PNG
member.summary: PNG image format. PNG is the default format for CollinsBart and OrdnanceSurvey imagery.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType
member.summary: Types of map imagery.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.Aerial
member.summary: Aerial imagery.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.AerialWithLabels
member.summary: Aerial imagery with a road overlay.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.Birdseye
member.summary: Bird’s eye (oblique-angle) imagery

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.BirdseyeWithLabels
member.summary: Bird’s eye imagery with a road overlay.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.CanvasDark
member.summary: A dark version of the road maps.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.CanvasLight
member.summary: A lighter version of the road maps which also has some of the details such as hill shading disabled.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.CanvasGray
member.summary: A grayscale version of the road maps.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.Road
member.summary: Roads without additional imagery. Uses legacy static tile service.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.RoadOnDemand
member.summary: Roads without additional imagery. Uses dynamic tile service.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.OrdnanceSurvey
member.summary: Ordnance Survey imagery.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryType.CollinsBart
member.summary: Collins Bart imagery

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteAttributeType
member.summary: The type of route attributes to include in a route response.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteAttributeType.All
member.summary: Used to specify the following attributes as a group: excluteItinerary, routePath, and transitStops.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteAttributeType.ExcludeItinerary
member.summary: Do not include detailed directions in the response. Detailed directions are provided as itinerary items and contain details such as written instructions and traffic location codes.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteAttributeType.RoutePath
member.summary: Include a set of point (latitude and longitude) values that describe the route’s path in the response.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteAttributeType.RouteSummariesOnly
member.summary: Include only travel time and distance for the route, and does not provide other information.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteAttributeType.TransitStops
member.summary: Include information about transit stops for transit routes.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptimizationType
member.summary: Specifies what parameters to use to optimize the route on the map.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptimizationType.Distance
member.summary: Optimizes route for shortest distance.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptimizationType.Time
member.summary: Optimizes route for shortest travel time.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptimizationType.TimeWithTraffic
member.summary: Optimizes route for shortest travel time with respect to current traffic conditions.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptimizationType.TimeAvoidClosure
member.summary: The route is calculated to minimize the time and avoid road closures. Traffic information is not used in the calculation.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteTimeType
member.summary: Specifies how to interpret the date and transit time value that is specified by the dateTime parameter.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteTimeType.Arrival
member.summary: The dateTime parameter contains the desired arrival time for a transit request.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteTimeType.Departure
member.summary: The dateTime parameter contains the desired departure time for a transit request.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteTimeType.LastAvailable
member.summary: The dateTime parameter contains the latest departure time available for a transit request.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TravelModeType
member.summary: The mode of travel for the route.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TravelModeType.Driving
member.summary: Driving mode.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TravelModeType.Walking
member.summary: Walking mode.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TravelModeType.Transit
member.summary: Transit mode.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SeverityType
member.summary: Specifies the severity level of a traffic incident.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SeverityType.LowImpact
member.summary: Low impact severity.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SeverityType.Minor
member.summary: Minor severity.

member.summary: Moderate severity.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SeverityType.Serious
member.summary: Serious severity.

member.summary: Converts a DateTime object into an OData date.
member.returns: An OData version of the DateTime.

member.summary: Converts an OData Date into a DateTime object.

member.summary: Bounding box generated from edge coordinates.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryPushpin
member.summary: Pushpin defination for Bing Maps REST imagery service: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff701719.aspx

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryPushpin.Location
member.summary: Coordinate to display pushpin.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryPushpin.IconStyle
member.summary: The icon style to use for the pushpin.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryPushpin.Label
member.summary: Label to display on top of pushpin.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions
member.summary: A class that defines the options that can to use when calculating a route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Avoid
member.summary: Specifies the road types to minimize or avoid when a route is created for the driving travel mode.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.DistanceBeforeFirstTurn
member.summary: Specifies the distance before the first turn is allowed in the route. This option only applies to the driving travel mode. An integer distance specified in meters. Use this parameter to make sure that the moving vehicle has enough distance to make the first turn.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Heading
member.summary: Specifies the initial heading for the route. An integer value between 0 and 359 that represents degrees from north where north is 0 degrees and the heading is specified clockwise from north.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Optimize
member.summary: Specifies what parameters to use to optimize the route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.TravelMode
member.summary: The mode of travel for the route. Default: Driving.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.DateTime
member.summary: The dateTime parameter identifies the desired time to be used when calculating a route. This is supported by driving and transit routes. When calculating driving routes the route optimization type should be TimeWithTraffic. The route time will be used as the departure time. When calculating transit routes timeType can be specified.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.TimeType
member.summary: Specifies how to interpret the date and transit time value that is specified by the dateTime parameter.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.RouteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies to include or exclude parts of the routes response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.DistanceUnits
member.summary: The units to use for distance.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.Tolerances
member.summary: Specifies a series of tolerance values. Each value produces a subset of points that approximates the route that is described by the full set of points. This parameter is only valid when the routePathOutput parameter is set to Points. You can specify a maximum of seven (7) tolerance values.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteOptions.MaxSolutions
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of transit or driving routes to return. An interger between 1 and 3. This parameter is available for the Driving and Transit travel modes for routes between two waypoints. This parameter does not support routes with more than two waypoints. For driving routes, you must not set the avoid and distanceBeforeFirstTurn parameters. The maxSolutions parameter is supported for routes in the United States, Canada, Mexico, United Kingdom, Australia, and India.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointRequest
member.summary: The Geospatial Endpoint Service is a REST service that provides information about Geospatial Platform services for the language and geographical region you specify. The service information includes available service endpoints and language support for these endpoints. Disputed geographical areas and embargoed countries or regions that do not have any service support are also identified. https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn948525.aspx

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointRequest.UseHTTPS
member.summary: When set to true the returned service URL's will use HTTPS.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL. If both a Query and Address are specified, the Query value will be used. Throws an exception if a Query or Address value is not specified.
member.returns: Geocode request URL for GET request.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest
member.summary: Requests imagery metadata information from Bing Maps.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.ImagerySet
member.summary: The type of imagery for which you are requesting metadata.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.CenterPoint
member.summary: Required when imagerySet is Birdseye or BirdseyeWithLabels. Optional for other imagery sets. The center point to use for the imagery metadata.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.GetBasicInfo
member.summary: Get only the basic metadata for an imagery set at a specific location. This URL does not return a map tile URL.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.IncludeImageryProviders
member.summary: When you specified the two-letter ISO country code is included for addresses in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.Orientation
member.summary: The orientation of the viewport to use for the imagery metadata. This option only applies to Birdseye imagery.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.ZoomLevel
member.summary: Required if a centerPoint is specified and imagerySet is set to Road, Aerial or AerialWithLabels The level of zoom to use for the imagery metadata.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.UseHTTPS
member.summary: When set to true tile URL's will use HTTPS.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryMetadataRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL. Throws an exception if a zoom level is not specified when a centerPoint is specified when ImagerySet is Road, Aerial and AerialWithLabels.
member.returns: Imagery Metadata request URL for GET request.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest
member.summary: Requests an image from the REST imagery service.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.ImagerySet
member.summary: The type of imagery for which you are requesting metadata.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.CenterPoint
member.summary: Required when imagerySet is Birdseye or BirdseyeWithLabels. Optional for other imagery sets. The center point to use for the imagery metadata.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.DeclutterPins
member.summary: Specifies whether to change the display of overlapping pushpins so that they display separately on a map.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.Format
member.summary: The image format to use for the static map.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.MapArea
member.summary: Required when a center point or set of route points are not specified. The geographic area to display on the map.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.ShowTraffic
member.summary: Specifies if the traffic flow layer should be displayed on the map or not. Default is false.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.MapWidth
member.summary: The width of the map. Default is 350px.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.MapHeight
member.summary: The height of the map. Default is 350px.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.GetMetadata
member.summary: Optional. Specifies whether to return metadata for the static map instead of the image. The static map metadata includes the size of the static map and the placement and size of the pushpins on the static map.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.Query
member.summary: A query string that is used to determine the map location to display.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.ZoomLevel
member.summary: The level of zoom to display.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.HighlightEntity
member.summary: Highlights a polygon for an entity.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.EntityType
member.summary: Indicates the type of entity that should be highlighted. The entity of this type that contains the centerPoint will be highlighted. Supported EntityTypes: CountryRegion, AdminDivision1, or PopulatedPlace.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.Pushpins
member.summary: List of pushpins to display on the map.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.Waypoints
member.summary: Specifies two or more locations that define the route and that are in sequential order. A route is defined by a set of waypoints and viaWaypoints (intermediate locations that the route must pass through). You can have a maximum of 25 waypoints, and a maximum of 10 viaWaypoints between each set of waypoints. The start and end points of the route cannot be viaWaypoints.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.RouteOptions
member.summary: Options for calculating route.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.Resolution
member.summary: Specifies the resolution of the labels on the image to retrieve.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL. If both a Query and Address are specified, the Query value will be used. Throws an exception if a Query or Address value is not specified.
member.returns: Geocode request URL for GET request.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.GetPostRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets a URL for requesting imagery data for a POST request.
member.returns: Imagery request URL for POST request.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ImageryRequest.GetPushpinsAsString
member.summary: Returns the Pushpin information as a formatted string.
member.returns: A formatted string of pushpin data.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.PointCompression
member.summary:
This compression algorithm encodes/decodes a collections of coordinates into a string. This algorithm is used for generating a compressed collection of coordinates for use with the Bing Maps REST Elevation Service. This algorithm is also used for decoding the compressed coordinates returned by the GeoData API.
These algorithms come from the following documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj158958.aspx http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn306801.aspx

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.PointCompression.Encode(System.Collections.Generic.List{BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate})
member.summary: Compresses a list of coordinates into a string. Based on: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj158958.aspx
member.returns: A compressed string representing a collection coordinates.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.PointCompression.TryDecode(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate}@)
member.summary: Decodes a collection of coordinates from a compressed string. Based on: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn306801.aspx
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the algorithm was able to decode the compressed coordinates or not.

member.summary: A waypoint to calculate a route through.

member.summary: A waypoint to calculate a route through.
member.param: Address or location description of waypoint.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleWaypoint.Coordinate
member.summary: The coordinate of the waypoint. When specified this will be used instead of the Address value in requests.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleWaypoint.Address
member.summary: The address query for the waypoint.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleWaypoint.IsViaPoint
member.summary: A bool indicating whether the waypoint is a via point.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseImageryRestRequest
member.summary: Abstract class that all Imagery rest requests will derive from.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest
member.summary: A request for elevation data.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.Points
member.summary: A set of coordinates on the Earth to use in elevation calculations. The exact use of these points depends on the type of elevation request. Overrides the Bounds value if both are specified. The maximum number of points is 1024.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.Bounds
member.summary: Specifies the rectangular area over which to provide elevation values.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.Row
member.summary: Specifies the number of rows to use to divide the bounding box area into a grid. The rows and columns that define the bounding box each count as two (2) of the rows and columns. Elevation values are returned for all vertices of the grid.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.Col
member.summary: Specifies the number of columns to use to divide the bounding box area into a grid. The rows and columns that define the bounding box each count as two (2) of the rows and columns. Elevation values are returned for all vertices of the grid.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.Samples
member.summary: Specifies the number of equally-spaced elevation values to provide along a polyline path. Used when Points value is set. Make = 1024

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.Height
member.summary: Specifies which sea level model to use to calculate elevation.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.GetGeoidOffset
member.summary: A boolean indicating if the offset from the geoid should be returned. Requires a list of points to be specified.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets a URL for requesting elevation data for a GET request.
member.returns: Elevation request URL for GET request.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.GetPostRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets a URL for requesting elevation data for a POST request.
member.returns: Elevation request URL for POST request.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.GetPointsAsString
member.summary: Returns the Point information as a formatted string. Only the first 1024 points will be used.
member.returns: A formatted string of point data.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationRequest.GetElevationCoordinates
member.summary: Gets a list of coordinates that are related to the returned index of the elevation data.
member.returns: A list of coordinates that are related to the index of the returned elevation data.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType
member.summary: Units of measurements for distances.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType.KM
member.summary: Distances in Kilometers.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType.Miles
member.summary: Distances in Miles

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationType
member.summary: Relative elevation type.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationType.Sealevel
member.summary: Geoid Earth model (EGM2008 2.5’).

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ElevationType.Ellipsoid
member.summary: Ellipsoid Earth model (WGS84).

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType
member.summary: Types of location based entities.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.Address
member.summary: A street address or RoadBlock.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.Neighborhood
member.summary: A section of a populated place that is typically well-known, but often with indistinct boundaries.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.PopulatedPlace
member.summary: A concentrated area of human settlement, such as a city, town or village.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.Postcode1
member.summary: The smallest post code category, such as a zip code.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.AdminDivision1
member.summary: First administrative level within the country/region level, such as a state or a province.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.AdminDivision2
member.summary: Second administrative level within the country/region level, such as a county.

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.EntityType.CountryRegion
member.summary: Country or region

member.returns: A stream with the data.

The content type of the data.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools
member.summary: A set of useful spatial math tools.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.EarthRadius
member.summary: The approximate spherical radius of the Earth

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.EarthRadius.KM
member.summary: Earth Radius in Kilometers

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.EarthRadius.Meters
member.summary: Earth Radius in Meters

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.EarthRadius.Miles
member.summary: Earth Radius in Miles

member.name: F:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.EarthRadius.Feet
member.summary: Earth Radius in Feet

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.GetEarthRadius(BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType)
member.summary: Retrieves the radius of the earth in a specific distance unit for WGS84.
member.returns: The radius of the earth in a specified distance units.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.ConvertDistance(System.Double,BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType,BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType)
member.summary: Converts distances from miles to km or km to miles.
member.param: The units that the distance is in.
The units to convert the distance to.
member.returns: A distance in the specified unit of measurement.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.ToRadians(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts an angle that is in degrees to radians. Angle * (PI / 180)
member.returns: An angle in radians

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.ToDegrees(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts an angle that is in radians to degress. Angle * (180 / PI)
member.returns: An angle in degrees

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.HaversineDistance(BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate,BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate,BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType)
member.summary: Calculate the distance between two coordinates on the surface of a sphere (Earth).
member.param: First coordinate to calculate distance between.
Second coordinate to calculate distance between.
member.returns: The shortest distance in the specifed units.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.HaversineDistance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType)
member.summary: Calculate the distance between two coordinates on the surface of a sphere (Earth).
member.returns: The shortest distance in the specifed units.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.CalculateBearing(BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate,BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate)
member.summary: Calculates the bearing between two coordinates.
member.returns: The bearing angle between two coordinates.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SpatialTools.CalculateCoord(BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate,System.Double,System.Double,BingMapsRESTToolkit.DistanceUnitType)
member.summary: Calculates a destination coordinate given a starting coordinate, bearing, and distance in KM's.
member.param: Unit of measurement of the arcLength
member.returns: A destination coordinate based on an origin point, bearing and distance.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleAddress
member.summary: A simple address class that can be passed in to requests.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleAddress.AddressLine
member.summary: The official street line of an address relative to the area, as specified by the Locality, or PostalCode, properties. Typical use of this element would be to provide a street address or any official address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleAddress.Locality
member.summary: The locality, such as the city or neighborhood, that corresponds to an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleAddress.AdminDistrict
member.summary: The subdivision name in the country or region for an address. This element is typically treated as the first order administrative subdivision, but in some cases it is the second, third, or fourth order subdivision in a country, dependency, or region.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleAddress.PostalCode
member.summary: The post code, postal code, or ZIP Code of an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.SimpleAddress.CountryRegion
member.summary: The ISO country code for the country.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest
member.summary: An abstract class in which all REST service requests derive from.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.BingMapsKey
member.summary: The Bing Maps key for making the request.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.Culture
member.summary: The culture to use for the request. An IETF language code, that includes the language and region code subtags, such as en-us or zh-hans.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.UserMapView
member.summary: The geographic region that corresponds to the current viewport.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.UserLocation
member.summary: The user’s current position.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.UserRegion
member.summary: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code, such as US, IN, and CN.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.UserIp
member.summary: An Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Abstract method which generates the Bing Maps REST request URL.
member.returns: A Bing Maps REST request URL.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteMajorRoadsRequest
member.summary: Requests routes from a location to major nearby roads.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteMajorRoadsRequest.Destination
member.summary: Specifies the final location for all the routes. A destination can be specified as a Point, a landmark, or an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteMajorRoadsRequest.ExcludeInstructions
member.summary: Specifies to return only starting points for each major route in the response. When this option is not specified, detailed directions for each route are returned.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteMajorRoadsRequest.DistanceUnits
member.summary: The units to use for distance.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteMajorRoadsRequest.RouteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies to include or exclude parts of the routes response.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteMajorRoadsRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL to perform a query for routes using major roads.
member.returns: A request URL to perform a query for routes using major roads.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest
member.summary: A request that calculates routes between waypoints.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.Waypoints
member.summary: Specifies two or more locations that define the route and that are in sequential order. A route is defined by a set of waypoints and viaWaypoints (intermediate locations that the route must pass through). You can have a maximum of 25 waypoints, and a maximum of 10 viaWaypoints between each set of waypoints. The start and end points of the route cannot be viaWaypoints.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.RouteOptions
member.summary: Options to use when calculate route.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.RouteRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL to perform a query for route directions.
member.returns: A request URL to perform a query for route directions.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ServiceManager
member.summary: A static class that processes requests to the Bing Maps REST services.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ServiceManager.GetResponseAsync(BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseRestRequest)
member.summary: Processes a REST requests that returns data.
member.returns: The response from the REST service.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ServiceManager.GetImageAsync(BingMapsRESTToolkit.BaseImageryRestRequest)
member.summary: Processes a REST requests that returns an image stream.
member.returns: A stream containing an image.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest
member.summary: Geocodes a query to its coordinates.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest.Query
member.summary: A free form string address or Landmark. Overrides the Address values if both are specified.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest.Address
member.summary: The Address to geocode.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest.MaxResults
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of locations to return in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest.IncludeIso2
member.summary: When you specified the two-letter ISO country code is included for addresses in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest.IncludeNeighborhood
member.summary: Specifies to include the neighborhood in the response when it is available.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeocodeRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL. If both a Query and Address are specified, the Query value will be used. Throws an exception if a Query or Address value is not specified.
member.returns: Geocode request URL for GET request.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate
member.summary: A class that defines location coordinate value.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate.#ctor
member.summary: A location coordinate.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: A location coordinate.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate.Latitude
member.summary: Latitude coordinate.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Coordinate.Longitude
member.summary: Longitude coordinate.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.CoverageArea.BoundingBox
member.summary: Bounding box of the coverage area. Structure [South Latitude, West Longitude, North Latitude, East Longitude]

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Point.Coordinates
member.summary: Latitude,Longitude

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.Resource.BoundingBox
member.summary: Bounding box of the response. Structure [South Latitude, West Longitude, North Latitude, East Longitude]

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse
member.summary: This response specifies: - Whether this is a politically disputed area, such as an area claimed by more than one country. - Whether services are available in the user’s region. - A list of available geospatial services including endpoints and language support for each service.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.IsDisputedArea
member.summary: Specifies if this area in the request is claimed by more than one country.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.IsSupported
member.summary: Specifies if Geospatial Platform services are available in the country or region. Microsoft does not support services in embargoed areas.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.UserRegion
member.summary: The country or region that was used to determine service support. If you specified a User Location in the request that is in a non-disputed country or region, this country or region is returned in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialEndpointResponse.Services
member.summary: Information for each geospatial service that is available in the country or region and language specified in the request.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService
member.summary: Information for a geospatial service that is available in the country or region and language specified in the request.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.Endpoint
member.summary: The URL service endpoint to use in this region. Note that to use the service, you must typically add parameters specific to the service. These parameters are not described in this documentation.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.FallbackLanguage
member.summary: Set to true if the service supports the language in the request for the region. If the language is supported, then the service endpoint will return responses using this language. If it is not supported, then the service will use the fallback language.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.LanguageSupported
member.summary: Specifies the secondary or fallback language in this region or country. If the requested language is not supported and a fallback language is not available, United States English (en-us) is used.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.GeospatialService.ServiceName
member.summary: An abbreviated name for the service.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ReverseGeocodeRequest
member.summary: Requests a that converts a coordinate into a location such as an address.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ReverseGeocodeRequest.Point
member.summary: A central coordinate to perform the nearby search.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ReverseGeocodeRequest.IncludeEntityTypes
member.summary: Specifies the entity types that you want to return in the response. Only the types you specify will be returned. If the point cannot be mapped to the entity types you specify, no location information is returned in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ReverseGeocodeRequest.IncludeIso2
member.summary: When you specified the two-letter ISO country code is included for addresses in the response.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ReverseGeocodeRequest.IncludeNeighborhood
member.summary: Specifies to include the neighborhood in the response when it is available.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.ReverseGeocodeRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets the request URL to perform a reverse geocode query.
member.returns: A request URL to perform a reverse geocode query.

member.name: T:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TrafficRequest
member.summary: Requests traffic information.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TrafficRequest.MapArea
member.summary: Specifies the area to search for traffic incident information. A rectangular area specified as a bounding box. The size of the area can be a maximum of 500 km x 500 km.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TrafficRequest.IncludeLocationCodes
member.summary: Specifies whether to include traffic location codes in the response. Traffic location codes provide traffic incident information for pre-defined road segments. A subscription is typically required to be able to interpret these codes for a geographical area or country. Default is false.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TrafficRequest.Severity
member.summary: Specifies severity level of traffic incidents to return. The default is to return traffic incidents for all severity levels.

member.name: P:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TrafficRequest.TrafficType
member.summary: Specifies the type of traffic incidents to return.

member.name: M:BingMapsRESTToolkit.TrafficRequest.GetRequestUrl
member.summary: Gets a URL for requesting traffic data for a GET request.
member.returns: Traffic request URL for GET request.
